001/*
002Written in 2015 by Sebastiano Vigna (vigna@acm.org)
003
004To the extent possible under law, the author has dedicated all copyright
005and related and neighboring rights to this software to the public domain
006worldwide. This software is distributed without any warranty.
007
008See <http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/>. */
009package squidpony.squidmath;
010
011/**
012 * This is a SplittableRandom-style generator, meant to have a tiny state
013 * that permits storing many different generators with low overhead.
014 * It should be rather fast, though no guarantees can be made.
015 * Written in 2015 by Sebastiano Vigna (vigna@acm.org)
016 * @author Sebastiano Vigna
017 * @author Tommy Ettinger
018 */
019public class LightRNG implements RandomnessSource
020{    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3L;
021
022    /** 2 raised to the 53, - 1. */
023    private static final long DOUBLE_MASK = ( 1L << 53 ) - 1;
024    /** 2 raised to the -53. */
025    private static final double NORM_53 = 1. / ( 1L << 53 );
026    /** 2 raised to the 24, -1. */
027    private static final long FLOAT_MASK = ( 1L << 24 ) - 1;
028    /** 2 raised to the -24. */
029    private static final double NORM_24 = 1. / ( 1L << 24 );
030
031    public long state; /* The state can be seeded with any value. */
032
033    /** Creates a new generator seeded using Math.random. */
034    public LightRNG() {
035        this((long)Math.floor(Math.random() * Long.MAX_VALUE));
036    }
037
038    public LightRNG( final long seed ) {
039        setSeed(seed);
040    }
041
042    @Override
043    public int next( int bits ) {
044        return (int)( nextLong() & ( 1L << bits ) - 1 );
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Can return any long, positive or negative, of any size permissible in a 64-bit signed integer.
049     * @return
050     */
051    public long nextLong() {
052        long z = ( state += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15l );
053        z = (z ^ (z >> 30)) * 0xBF58476D1CE4E5B9l;
054        z = (z ^ (z >> 27)) * 0x94D049BB133111EBl;
055        return z ^ (z >> 31);
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Can return any int, positive or negative, of any size permissible in a 32-bit signed integer.
060     * @return
061     */
062    public int nextInt() {
063        return (int)nextLong();
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Exclusive on the upper bound n.  The lower bound is 0.
068     * @param n
069     * @return
070     */
071    public int nextInt( final int n ) {
072        if ( n <= 0 ) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
073        for(;;) {
074            final int bits = nextInt();
075            final int value = bits % n;
076            if ( bits - value + ( n - 1 ) >= 0 ) return value;
077        }
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Inclusive lower, exclusive upper.
082     * @param lower
083     * @param upper
084     * @return
085     */
086    public int nextInt( final int lower, final int upper ) {
087        if ( upper - lower <= 0 ) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
088        return lower + nextInt(upper - lower);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Exclusive on the upper bound n. The lower bound is 0.
093     * @param n
094     * @return
095     */
096    public long nextLong( final long n ) {
097        if ( n <= 0 ) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
098        for(;;) {
099            final long bits = nextLong() >>> 1;
100            final long value = bits % n;
101            if ( bits - value + ( n - 1 ) >= 0 ) return value;
102        }
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Gets a uniform random double in the range [0.0,1.0)
107     * @return
108     */
109    public double nextDouble() {
110        return ( nextLong() & DOUBLE_MASK ) * NORM_53;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Gets a uniform random double in the range [0.0,upper) given the parameter upper.
115     * @param upper
116     * @return
117     */
118    public double nextDouble(final double upper) {
119        return nextDouble() * upper;
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Gets a uniform random float in the range [0.0,1.0)
124     * @return
125     */
126    public float nextFloat() {
127        return (float)( ( nextLong() & FLOAT_MASK ) * NORM_24 );
128    }
129
130    public boolean nextBoolean() {
131        return ( nextLong() & 1 ) != 0;
132    }
133
134    public void nextBytes( final byte[] bytes ) {
135        int i = bytes.length, n = 0;
136        while( i != 0 ) {
137            n = Math.min( i, 8 );
138            for ( long bits = nextLong(); n-- != 0; bits >>= 8 ) bytes[ --i ] = (byte)bits;
139        }
140    }
141
142
143    /**
144     * Sets the seed of this generator (which is also the current state).
145     */
146    public void setSeed( final long seed ) {
147        state = seed;
148    }
149    /**
150     * Sets the seed (also the current state) of this generator.
151     */
152    public void setState( final long seed ) {
153        state = seed;
154    }
155    /**
156     * Gets the current state of this generator.
157     */
158    public long getState( ) {
159        return state;
160    }
161}
